conclusion: Analyze forces acting on object A before and after it rises.
Initially, spring B is unstretched and spring C is horizontal and not deformed.
Spring B is vertical and connected to object A, spring C is horizontal and connected to a fixed pulley.
Gravitational force on A is 20 N, spring force from B is 0 initially.
Initially, A is in equilibrium with no vertical displacement, tension T equals gravitational force mg.
When spring C is pulled to position b, tension force of spring B equals gravitational force of A.
F_B' equals mg, which is 20 N.
F_B' equals k_1 times x_1, so 200 times x_1 equals 20, leading to x_1 equals 0.1 m.
Height A rises is 0.1 m due to compression of spring B.
Spring C is extended by 0.6 m when pulled to position b.
Force exerted by spring C is F_C equals k_2 times x_2.
Tension in rope balancing gravitational force of A is 20 N, so F_C equals 20 N.
k_2 times 0.6 equals 20, leading to k_2 equals 33.33 N/m.
Final answer: height A rises is 0.1 m and stiffness coefficient k_2 is 33.33 N/m.
